description: ​​The U.S. Justice Department arrested a Nashville man charged with helping North Korean IT workers obtain remote work at companies across the United States and operating a laptop farm they used to pose as U.S.-based individuals. [...]
title: US dismantles laptop farm used by undercover North Korean IT workers

description: Cisco is warning of multiple critical remote code execution zero-days in the web-based management interface of the end-of-life Small Business SPA 300 and SPA 500 series IP phones. [...]
title: Cisco warns of critical RCE zero-days in end of life IP phones

description: ​Microsoft reminded today that Exchange 2016 will reach the end of extended support next year on October 14 and shared guidance for admins who need to decommission outdated servers. [...]
title: Microsoft: Exchange 2016 reaches extended end of support in October

description: Cisco warns that exploit code is now available for a maximum severity vulnerability that lets attackers change any user password on unpatched Cisco Smart Software Manager On-Prem (Cisco SSM On-Prem) license servers. [...]
title: Exploit released for Cisco SSM bug allowing admin password changes

description: CISA recommends disabling the legacy Cisco Smart Install feature after seeing it abused by threat actors in recent attacks to steal sensitive data, such as system configuration files. [...]
title: CISA warns of hackers abusing Cisco Smart Install feature

description: A vulnerability disclosed 18 years ago, dubbed "0.0.0.0 Day", allows malicious websites to bypass security in Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and Apple Safari and interact with services on a local network. [...]
title: 18-year-old security flaw in Firefox and Chrome exploited in attacks

description: ADT Inc. disclosed via a Form 8-K filing at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) that hackers have gained access to its systems, which hold customer order details. [...]
title: ADT confirms data breach after customer info leaked on hacking forum
